Title.evidence: This study was a multicenter, double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This study was a multicenter, double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial that randomly assigned patients to dexmedetomidine or saline placebo

Participants.evidence: Participants were elderly (>68 years) patients undergoing major elective noncardiac surgery.

Intervention.evidence: Dexmedetomidine infusion (0.5 µg/kg/h) during surgery and up to 2 hours in the recovery room.

Objective.evidence: Objective: To evaluate whether an intraoperative infusion of dexmedetomidine reduces postoperative delirium.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Patients were assessed daily for postoperative delirium (primary outcome)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomly assigned patients to dexmedetomidine or saline placebo

Number_Randomised.evidence: In total, 404 patients were randomized; 390 completed in-hospital delirium assessments

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no difference in postoperative delirium between the dexmedetomidine and placebo groups (12.2% [23 of 189] vs 11.4% [23 of 201], P = .94).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were comparably distributed in the treatment groups.
